shortdesc.ph: Seeks to the specified playback position in the media file.
Seeks to the specified playback position in the media file.
Seeks to the specified playback position in the media file.
Seeks to the specified playback position in the media file.

ul.li: If you call after playback has completed (when the callback reports the playback state as PlayerStatePlaybackCompleted or PlayerStatePlaybackAllLoopsCompleted), and the call succeeds, the SDK automatically starts playback from the specified position. In this case, you receive the callback reporting the playback state as PlayerStatePlaying.
If you call while playback is paused, upon successful call, the SDK seeks to the specified position. To resume playback, call or .

If you call after playback has completed (as indicated by the callback reporting the playback state as PlayerStatePlaybackCompleted or PlayerStatePlaybackAllLoopsCompleted), the SDK automatically starts playback from the specified position upon a successful call. You will receive an callback reporting the playback state as PlayerStatePlaying.
If you call while playback is paused, the SDK seeks to the specified position upon success. To resume playback, call or .

If you call after playback has completed (i.e., you received the callback reporting the playback state as playerStatePlaybackCompleted or playerStatePlaybackAllLoopsCompleted), the SDK will automatically start playback from the specified position upon success. You will receive the callback reporting the state as playerStatePlaying.
If you call while playback is paused, the SDK will seek to the specified position upon success. To start playback, call or .

If you call after playback has completed (as indicated by the callback reporting the status as PLAYER_STATE_PLAYBACK_COMPLETED or PLAYER_STATE_PLAYBACK_ALL_LOOPS_COMPLETED), the SDK will automatically start playback from the specified position upon successful call. You will receive an callback reporting the status as PLAYER_STATE_PLAYING.
If you call while playback is paused, the SDK will seek to the specified position upon success. To play, call or .

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method can be called both before and after joining a channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After this method is successfully called, you receive the callback reporting events such as seek start, success, or failure.
After a successful call to this method, you will receive an callback reporting events such as seeking started, seeking succeeded, or seeking failed.
After successfully calling this method, you will receive the callback reporting events such as seek start, seek success, or seek failure.
After successfully calling this method, you will receive an callback reporting events such as seek start, seek success, or seek failure.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
